Name: Discounted bike share rate for public school students aged 16 or older.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a discounted bike share rate for public school students aged 16 or older

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Transportation to set a discounted rate for New York City public school students aged 16 or older as part of the City’s bike share program.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subchapter 3 of chapter 1 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-192 to read as follows:
      � 19-192 Discounted bike share rate for public school students. a. Definitions. As used in this section, the following terms have the following meanings:
      Bike share operator. The term "bike share operator" means the company operating the bike share program under a contract entered into through the department. 
      Bike share program. The term "bike share program" means the program through which public bicycles are provided for shared use within the city under a contract between the department and the bike share operator that permits payment for the use of such bicycles. 
      Public school. The term "public school" means any school of the city school district.
      b. The department shall require the provision of a discounted rate for participation in the bike share program for public school students aged 16 or older as part of the bike share program. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect 45 days after it becomes law.

KF
